WRITING.TEXT: And who would have a siege tick ? Couldn't be anyone than kebabs

Administrative is a must for anything else than merchant republics thinking of staying a Merchant Republic. After that, its your choice. Take your ideas depending on your country. If you were the Commonwealth, innonative would be unwise as your %33 cavalry combat abilty can be stacked with aristocracy+ aristocracy-espionage policy to crushingly deadly effect. (Even deadlier for the hordes, try it out !)
%25 coring discount is the single best idea in the game. Get it before coring anything, it adds up to huge amounts of adm points as time goes, and is the secret behind the Kebab success.

Exactly. And the real thing is, Erdogan was an ally of this cult of followers, and had a lot of help from them. But, after awhile they drifted away and yeh... recent events happened.
(I live in Turkey)

Go for the south african gold. Grab them all and develop those provinces on production. With massive money get the best advisors. And import all the institutions with your extra points. This seems to be a good tactic with asian nations now, as there's no need to make contact with the decadent west anymore.

They get the good janissary bonus and their normal bonuses from ideas as well, so it would be unwise to face them in open battle. Instead build mountain-forest forts and get a military engineer, scorch the forts and relieve the castles who are close to surrendering.

Although you can, you can only do this by mid-late game and army tradition gives morale, which is not that good by then. Instead go for discipline-extra fire+shock modifiers. I experimented with both, and with extra modifiers I always got good-god generals even though I was often like at 5-10 tradition.
